title: Economic Dream Team Machine
description:
With the U.S. presidential election entering its final days, the jockeying for prime roles in helping shape economic policy has begun in earnest. Who will run the Department of Treasury? Who will advise the next occupant of the White House on economic policy? What about the U.S. Trade Representative or Commerce Secretary? And what happens if Janet Yellen is a one-term Federal Reserve chair? Ben White, chief economic correspondent at Politico, and Gina Chon, Washington columnist for Breakingviews, help answer these questions and more.
 The Economic Dream Team Machine: http://www.reuters.com/economic-dream-team
  
 The Exchange is a regular conversation with influential and interesting people hosted by Rob Cox, global editor of Breakingviews, the financial commentary publication of Thomson Reuters. From Reuters’ global headquarters in New York’s Times Square, Rob and his colleagues debate and discuss...
